isis.stitle: TSI 97-08-07 - Wabco and New Allied Signal (Bendix) ABS Controllers

subjectgroup.subject: Wabco and New Allied Signal (Bendix) ABS Controllers

lev1.para: This TSI applies to all models with air ABS.

Effective February 17, 1997, Navistar will implement a change to a new Bendix and Wabco ABS controller. The new Bendix and Wabco ABS controller is interchangeable with current Bendix and Wabco ABS controllers for service.

lev2.title: ABS Dash Warning Light
lev2.para: The ABS warning light will be illuminated at engine start-up for approximately two seconds and then extinguish after a successful self test of the electrical system. If an error is detected at any time, the dash light will stay illuminated.

Prior to the new Bendix ABS controller, the dash light would blink and then stay on until the vehicle was driven to a speed of approximately 7 mph and then go out. If a system fault was detected, the ABS warning light would stay illuminated.

lev2.title: Autocalibration
lev2.para: The new Bendix ABS controller has an autocalibration feature which will compensate for rolling radius differences that are commonly encountered between front and rear tires. Many fleets specify tires that have significant differences between the front and rear tires. The dealer/ user will not have to perform any activity for the autocalibration to occur. This eliminates the need for a dealer to stock different ABS controllers for different rolling radiuses.

lev2.title: ABS Dash Warning Light
lev2.para: When the Wabco controller is initially put into service, or each time the controller is serviced (fault codes cleared using the Prolink electronic tool or the blink light switch), the vehicle must be driven above 4 mph to extinguish the ABS dash warning light. Once the ABS dash warning light is extinguished, the ABS dash warning light will function in the same manner as the Bendix ABS dash warning light previously mentioned.

lev2.title: Autocalibration
lev2.para: The autocalibration feature has always been available with the Wabco controller, therefore there is no change with the current system.
